intro: Tieghemia rogersii, commonly known as the Rogers' tieghemia, is a rare and endangered species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it has elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
